page.title: 03POLBERRO MINE
page.content: IN 1846 POLBERRO MINE WAS VISITED BY QUEEN VICTORIA SO AFTER THAT IT WAS KNOWN AS ROYAL POLBERRO.THE MINE WAS ALSO CALLED TURNAVORE.ONE DAY A TRACTOR WAS PLOUGHING IN THE FIELD NEXT TO POLBERRO MINE WITH A FURROW. WHEN THEY STOPPED THE TRACTOR THEY LOOKED IN THE FURROW AND FOUND BLACK TIN.THE CORNISH WORD FOR FURROW IS VORE, SO THEY CALLED THE MINE TURNAVORE.IT WAS BUILT IN 1837.IT OPENED IN 1837 AND SHUT IN 1895.IT REOPENED IN 1937 AND SHUT AGAIN IN 1941.IN THE EARLY YEARS IT PRODUCED 4300 TONS OF BLACK TIN.IT WAS ONE OF THE RICHEST MINES IN CORNWALL. TODAY ALL THAT REMAINS IS THE DERELICT ENGINE HOUSE.
